definition: to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview

sentences.english: And their home, also resembling is boudoir beauty, see inaccessibly .
sentences.chinese: 而他们的家，也像是深闺美人，难得一见。

sentences.english: By rare we meant they are probably not ordinary clouds you get to witness everyday.
sentences.chinese: 我们所谓的难得一见是指非每天常见的云。

sentences.english: This bit of her act is really a moment of puppeteering history.
sentences.chinese: 她的这段表演实在是木偶戏历史上难得一见的一幕。

sentences.english: Rock is a rarity on an island of sand.
But stars are rarely seen in the haze of Beijing.
sentences.chinese: 但是在北京的光晕里星星难得一见。

sentences.english: Collection of creative and unusual coasters from around the world.
sentences.chinese: 汇集您难得一见的全世界最富创意的茶杯垫。

sentences.english: Welcome to P. Schuyler & Sons, dealers in the rare and beautiful.
sentences.chinese: 欢迎来到斯凯勒父子公司“难得一见”店铺。

sentences.english: As we approached the summit we were vouchsafed a rare vision.
sentences.chinese: 快到山顶时，我们有幸看到了难得一见的景象。

sentences.english: Immigrant networks are a rare bright spark in the world economy.
sentences.chinese: 移民经济是世界经济中难得一见的亮点。

sentences.english: Kennedy was a rare and charismatic politician.
sentences.chinese: 甘乃迪是难得一见有魅力的政治家。

sentences.english: You may never have another chance to see it.
sentences.chinese: 机会难得，以后你可能就难得一见了。

sentences.english: This lush paradise is home to creatures barely known and thousands more that wait to be discovered.
sentences.chinese: 绿色家园中住着难得一见，或许多未为人知的动物。

definition: rare/not familiar (to the speaker)/sth rarely experience/hard to see
one and only (idiom); rarely seen/unique of its kind
lit. as rare as phoenix feathers and unicorn horns (idiom)/fig. few and far between
incomparable/none to compare with at that time
can be discovered but not sought (idiom)/one can only come across such things serendipitously
can be counted on one's fingers (idiom)/very few
best quality/item of the highest quality/(slang) outrageous/annoying in the extreme/gross/person with these qualities
